sources.title: Snafuperman (1944)
sources.description: Snafuperman is a 1944 animated short comedy produced by Warner Bros. and directed by Friz Freleng. It is one of a series of black and white “Private Snafu” cartoons created for the Army-Navy Screen Magazine and shown only to American soldiers. The “Private Snafu” cartoons were not released commercially, until December 2010. The cartoon’s title is a play on “Superman” and parodies the popular Superman cartoons of the 1940s. Watch on RetroFlix.org:  https://retroflix.org/snafuperman-1944/

metadata.Plot: Pvt. Snafu becomes a superhero, only for him to become the world's dumbest one because he won't study his field manuals.
